meanings.definition: The state or condition of being synchronous.
meanings.sent1: The synchroneities of the clocks in the house made it easy to keep track of time.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played with perfect synchroneities, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent3: The synchroneities of the traffic lights seemed to be playing a game of red light, green light.
meanings.sent4: The synchroneities of the dancers on stage resembled a perfectly choreographed ballet.
meanings.sent5: The synchroneities of the planets moving in orbit around the sun were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: Events or occurrences happening at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The synchroneities of the thunder and lightning made the storm even more intense.
meanings.sent2: The synchroneities of the fireworks and music created a spectacular show.
meanings.sent3: The synchroneities of the dogs barking and the doorbell ringing confused the delivery person.
meanings.sent4: The synchroneities of the waves crashing against the shore and seagulls flying overhead painted a serene scene.
meanings.sent5: The synchroneities of the cars honking and people shouting in the city added to the chaos of rush hour.
